trans-unit.source: Walkthrough-- Port a simple Direct3D 9 app to DirectX 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP)
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough-- Port a simple Direct3D 9 app to DirectX 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP)

trans-unit.source: This porting exercise shows how to bring a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
trans-unit.target: This porting exercise shows how to bring a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough: Port a simple Direct3D 9 app to DirectX 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP)
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough: Port a simple Direct3D 9 app to DirectX 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP)

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This porting exercise shows how to bring a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
trans-unit.target: This porting exercise shows how to bring a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11 and Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Initialize Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Initialize Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Shows how to convert Direct3D 9 initialization code to Direct3D 11, including how to get handles to the Direct3D device and the device context and how to use DXGI to set up a swap chain.
trans-unit.target: Shows how to convert Direct3D 9 initialization code to Direct3D 11, including how to get handles to the Direct3D device and the device context and how to use DXGI to set up a swap chain.

trans-unit.source: Convert the rendering framework
trans-unit.target: Convert the rendering framework

trans-unit.source: Shows how to convert a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11, including how to port geometry buffers, how to compile and load HLSL shader programs, and how to implement the rendering chain in Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: Shows how to convert a simple rendering framework from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11, including how to port geometry buffers, how to compile and load HLSL shader programs, and how to implement the rendering chain in Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: Port the game loop
trans-unit.target: Port the game loop

trans-unit.source: Shows how to implement a window for a UWP game and how to bring over the game loop, including how to build an [IFrameworkView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700478) to control a full-screen [CoreWindow](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225).
trans-unit.target: Shows how to implement a window for a UWP game and how to bring over the game loop, including how to build an [IFrameworkView](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700478) to control a full-screen [CoreWindow](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225).

trans-unit.source: This topic walks through two code paths that perform the same basic graphics task: display a rotating vertex-shaded cube.
trans-unit.target: This topic walks through two code paths that perform the same basic graphics task: display a rotating vertex-shaded cube.

trans-unit.source: In both cases, the code covers the following process:
trans-unit.target: In both cases, the code covers the following process:

trans-unit.source: Creating a Direct3D device and a swap chain.
trans-unit.target: Creating a Direct3D device and a swap chain.

trans-unit.source: Creating a vertex buffer, and an index buffer, to represent a colorful cube mesh.
trans-unit.target: Creating a vertex buffer, and an index buffer, to represent a colorful cube mesh.

trans-unit.source: Creating a vertex shader that transforms vertices to screen space, a pixel shader that blends color values, compiling the shaders, and loading the shaders as Direct3D resources.
trans-unit.target: Creating a vertex shader that transforms vertices to screen space, a pixel shader that blends color values, compiling the shaders, and loading the shaders as Direct3D resources.

trans-unit.source: Implementing the rendering chain and presenting the drawn cube to the screen.
trans-unit.target: Implementing the rendering chain and presenting the drawn cube to the screen.

trans-unit.source: Creating a window, starting a main loop, and taking care of window message processing.
trans-unit.target: Creating a window, starting a main loop, and taking care of window message processing.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with the following basic differences between Direct3D 9 and Direct3D 11:
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with the following basic differences between Direct3D 9 and Direct3D 11:

trans-unit.source: The separation of device, device context, and graphics infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: The separation of device, device context, and graphics infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: The process of compiling shaders, and loading shader bytecode at runtime.
trans-unit.target: The process of compiling shaders, and loading shader bytecode at runtime.

trans-unit.source: How to configure per-vertex data for the Input Assembler (IA) stage.
trans-unit.target: How to configure per-vertex data for the Input Assembler (IA) stage.

trans-unit.source: How to use an [**IFrameworkView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700478) to create a CoreWindow view.
trans-unit.target: How to use an [**IFrameworkView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700478) to create a CoreWindow view.

trans-unit.source: Note that this walkthrough uses [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) for simplicity, and does not cover XAML interop.
trans-unit.target: Note that this walkthrough uses [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) for simplicity, and does not cover XAML interop.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You should [Prepare your dev environment for UWP DirectX game development](prepare-your-dev-environment-for-windows-store-directx-game-development.md).
trans-unit.target: You should [Prepare your dev environment for UWP DirectX game development](prepare-your-dev-environment-for-windows-store-directx-game-development.md).

trans-unit.source: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to load the code samples for this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to load the code samples for this walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Visit [Porting concepts and considerations](porting-considerations.md) to gain a better understanding of the DirectX 11 and UWP programming concepts shown in this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: Visit [Porting concepts and considerations](porting-considerations.md) to gain a better understanding of the DirectX 11 and UWP programming concepts shown in this walkthrough.
